slides.title: What is Conservation?
slides.content:
# Protection üõ°Ô∏è

The preservation and careful management of the environment and natural resources.
- Goal: Prevent extinction and maintain biodiversity.

slides.title: Extinction Crisis
slides.content:
# The Sixth Extinction ü¶ï

Species are dying out 1000x faster than normal background rate.
- Cause: Humans (Habitat loss, Hunting, Climate Change, Pollution).
- We are the asteroid.

slides.title: Protected Areas
slides.content:
# Safe Zones üèûÔ∏è

National Parks, Marine Reserves.
- Land set aside where nature comes first.
- **Yellowstone**: World's first National Park (1872).
- Goal: Protect 30% of Earth by 2030 (30x30).

slides.title: Endangered Species
slides.content:
# Red List üìï

IUCN Classification:
- **Least Concern** (Pigeons).
- **Vulnerable** (Lion).
- **Endangered** (Tiger).
- **Critically Endangered** (Rhino).
- **Extinct in Wild**.
- **Extinct** (Dodo).

slides.title: Habitat Fragmentation
slides.content:
# Broken Homes üß©

Roads/Farms cutting up wild areas.
- Animals can't find mates or food.
- Solution: **Wildlife Corridors** (Bridges over highways).

slides.title: Status Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which organization manages the 'Red List' of threatened species?

slides.title: Invasive Species Control
slides.content:
# Weeding üåø

Removing non-natives.
- Pulling weeds.
- Hunting destructive animals (Rats on islands).
- Biocontrol (Releasing a natural enemy - Risky!).

slides.title: Ex Situ Conservation
slides.content:
# Off Site ü¶Å

Saving species outside their habitat.
- **Zoos**: Breeding programs.
- **Seed Banks**: Storing seeds in ice (Svalbard Doomsday Vault).
- **Botanical Gardens**.

slides.title: Restoration Ecology
slides.content:
# Fixing It üõ†Ô∏è

Repairing damaged ecosystems.
- Reforestation (Planting trees).
- Wetland restoration.
- Rewilding (Bringing back wolves to Yellowstone).

slides.title: Poaching
slides.content:
# Illegal Hunting üî´

Killing for parts (Ivory, Rhino Horn).
- Driven by black market demand.
- Anti-poaching rangers protect animals.

slides.title: Keystone Species
slides.content:
# Arch Stone üèõÔ∏è

Species that holds the ecosystem together.
- **Beavers**: Build dams, create wetlands.
- **Wolves**: Control deer, protect plants.
- **Bees**: Pollinate everything.

slides.title: Genetic Bottleneck
slides.content:
# Inbreeding üß¨

When population drops too low, genetic diversity is lost.
- Makes population weak to disease.
- Cheetahs are all almost clones.

slides.title: Pillar Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: A species that has a disproportionately large effect on its environment is called a:

slides.title: The Ocean Cleanup
slides.content:
# Plastic Soup ü•§

Removing plastic from the GPGP (Great Pacific Garbage Patch).
- Difficult task.
- Better to stop plastic at source (Rivers).

slides.title: Citizen Science
slides.content:
# You Help ü§≥

Normal people helping science.
- Counting birds in backyard.
- Measuring water quality.
- Apps like iNaturalist.

slides.title: Ecotourism
slides.content:
# Paying to See üì∏

Making animals worth more alive than dead.
- Money from safaris encourages locals to protect lions.
- Must be managed to not disturb animals.

slides.title: Flagship Species
slides.content:
# The Poster Child üêº

Charismatic animals used to raise support.
- Panda (WWF).
- Tiger.
- Saving them saves their habitat (Umbrella Effect).

slides.title: Indigenous Knowledge
slides.content:
# Ancient Wisdom üõñ

Indigenous people protect 80% of remaining biodiversity.
- Working with them is essential for conservation.

slides.title: Conservation Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Biodiversity is our life support.
- Habitat protection is key.
- Restoration can heal the land.
- Can we share the Earth?
